ADDEDCFLAGS.description: These optional flags will be passed to the compiler when building the source code for the kernel libraries in the VSB.

ADDEDUSERCFLAGS.summary: Optional RTP shared libraries and static libraries compiler flags [?]
ADDEDUSERCFLAGS.description: These optional flags will be passed to the compiler when building the source code for the RTP shared libraries and static libraries in the VSB.

ADDEDCFLAGS_APP.description: These optional flags will be passed to the compiler when building the source code for the RTP applications in the VSB.

SMP.description: This option enables SMP support in the VxWorks kernel.

REMOVE_UNUSED_FUNCTIONS.description: Tell compiler/linker to remove unreferenced functions and data

DETERMINISTIC_SMP.description: This option allows users to tune VxWorks SMP for determinism or performance. By default, this option is selected and ensures that VxWorks SMP is deterministic. When this option is not selected, i.e. n is specified, the user has chosen to forgo deterministic behavior in parts of VxWorks SMP for performance gains. For example, selecting this option means that deterministic spinlocks are used instead of non-deterministic spinlocks in SMP implementations of the network stack and System Viewer.

VXTEST_BUILD.description: This option enables VxWorks Test Code Building

DEBUG_FLAG.description: This option enables the generation of debugging information in binaries. If source level debugging is required disable REPRODUCIBLE_BUILD_PATH. Toolchains will use this flag to turn on debugging and disable some optimizations that could make debugging more difficult. Specific flags and options used depend on the toolchains. Source layers may also use this option to build additional or alternate code for debugging purpose.

DEBUG_FLAG_ALLOW_OPTIMIZATION.summary: Allow Debug -g and Optimization to co-exist
DEBUG_FLAG_ALLOW_OPTIMIZATION.description: This flag will allow the normal -O flags to be used with the -g (Debug) flag. This may result in images that can not be debugged properly and is not a recommended option.

REPRODUCIBLE_BUILD_PATH.summary: Enable the setting of a file prefix used in a reproducible build
REPRODUCIBLE_BUILD_PATH.description: Enables the capability of setting the REPRODUCIBLE_BUILD_PATH_PREFIX. Disable this option if source level debuggin is required with the DEBUG_FLAG. This option also auto includes the component INCLUDE_OMIT_PROJECT_ENV in a VIP, the user can remove this component if required.

REPRODUCIBLE_BUILD_PATH_PREFIX.summary: Set the file prefix used in a reproducible build
REPRODUCIBLE_BUILD_PATH_PREFIX.description: Set the __FILE__ prefix to be used with the file name in a reproducible build. Reproducible builds, also known as deterministic compilation, is a process of compiling software which ensures the resulting binary code can be reproduced. Source code compiled using deterministic compilation will always output the same binary

REPRODUCIBLE_BUILD_DATE.summary: Set the Date used in a reproducible build
REPRODUCIBLE_BUILD_DATE.description: Set the __DATE__ to use in a reproducible build must be in the format of Jan 1 1970. Reproducible builds, also known as deterministic compilation, is a process of compiling software which ensures the resulting binary code can be reproduced. Source code compiled using deterministic compilation will always output the same binary

REPRODUCIBLE_BUILD_TIME.summary: Set the Time used in a reproducible build
REPRODUCIBLE_BUILD_TIME.description: Set the __TIME__ to use in a reproducible build must be in the format of 00:00:00. Reproducible builds, also known as deterministic compilation, is a process of compiling software which ensures the resulting binary code can be reproduced. Source code compiled using deterministic compilation will always output the same binary

CUSTOM_LINKER_SCRIPT.description: Use a custom linker script instead of the default linker script. When set, a file at the given path will be used. Variables such as $(VSB_DIR) can be used to make the path relative. For example, $(VSB_DIR)/../foo.script will use a linker script called foo.script in the VSB's parent directory.

ENABLE_CACHED_PAGE_TBL.description: This option enables or disables the optimization for cached page table entries.

VFP_RUN_FAST.description: This option may speed up the performance of floating point math, but should only be used when strict IEEE 754 compliance is not required. It enables VFP flush-to-zero and default NAN modes, as well as fast-math support in the compiler.

SUPPORT_XEN.description: This option may add support for XEN platform.

ARM_DBG_HARDWARE_BP.description: By default the hardware breakpoint is supported if the hardware implements monitor debug mode.

UNIFIED_FIQ_IRQ.description: This option allows FIQ exceptions to be handled in the same manner as IRQs.

ARM_DBG_HARDWARE_SS.description: By default the hardware single step is supported if the hardware implements it.

UNMAP_FIRST_PAGE.summary: Unmap the first page to detect the NULL pointer dereference

ARM7A_IRQ_NEST_LEVEL_MAX.summary: Configure the armv7a maximum number of nesting level
ARM7A_IRQ_NEST_LEVEL_MAX.description: This option will affect size of irqStack for irq/fiq mode.

ARM_NEED_ATOMIC_ALIGN.summary: Align spinlock at cache line to avoid two or more spinlocks sharing the same cache line

CORE_3_2_2_0.description: The following core libraries are provided: IO, KERNEL, LDSO, SAFETY, USER.

OBJECT_MANAGEMENT.description: This feature enables the WIND object management support. When selected, this option enables the selection of WIND object ID verification (OBJECT_VERIFICATION) and/or the WIND object class list management (OBJECT_CLASS_LIST) options for the VxWorks kernel. With this option de-selected, neither object ID verification nor object class list management are selected. See OBJECT_VERIFICATION option and OBJECT_CLASS_LIST help text for more detail information on each of the options.

OBJECT_VERIFICATION.description: This feature will include WIND object ID validation in the VxWorks kernel source. Without the selection of OBJECT_VERIFICATION, WIND objects passed to VxWorks kernel APIs, such as semTake() and semGive(), will not be validated. For a system where objects are not deleted, the overhead of the validation can be removed from the kernel APIs by de-selecting this option. Some VxWorks features are indirectly affected by the removal of this feature. For example, memory partitions are validated by verification of the partition semaphore. Without WIND object verification operations on an invalid memory partition will yield undefined results.

OBJECT_CLASS_LIST.description: This option is used to link allocated WIND objects together for debugging by tools to display the objects. De-selecting this option will improve the performance of certain kernel APIs, but will reduce the functionality of certain debug facilities and features, such as the searching of WIND objects by name or opening an object by name via the XXXOpen() APIs or the objEach() API. With this option de-selected, the following features will not work and must not be configured into VxWorks: INCLUDE_OBJ_OPEN, INCLUDE_CLASS_SHOW, and INCLUDE_OBJ_INFO. De-selecting this option does not remove list management for tasks, to preserve the task debugging capabilities with the VxWorks tools. In addition this option is necessary to support System Viewer trigger and both POSIX semaphores and POSIX message queues.

USER_RTP_SPAWN_BUFFER_VAL_OFF_DISABLE.description: If an RTP application invokes rtpSpawn() with the RTP_BUFFER_VAL_OFF option, this configuration is used to ignore the option, RTP_BUFFER_VAL_OFF. By default, this configuration is enabled which means it requires RTP buffer validation for security purpose. Alternatively, if a user is assured of the RTP application's intention and the quality of the source, then they may choose to disable this configuration and set the option, RTP_BUFFER_VAL_OFF, in rtpSpawn(), to gain run-time performance for those application.

TASK_CREATE_HOOKS.description: This option allows user installed call-outs when task is created or deleted. The call-outs allow additional routines, or hooks, to be invoked whenever these events occur.

TASK_SWITCH_HOOKS.description: This option allows user installed call-outs when task is switched. The call-outs allow additional routines, or hooks, to be invoked whenever these events occur.

SYS_PWR_OFF.description: This option provides terminal device access use to serial channels.

SYS_PWR_MGMT.description: This option enables system power management to the extent supported by the architecture. Without this option selected, limited CPU-specific power management may be available for CPU variants that support it.

CPU_PWR_MGMT.description: This option is for utilization-based CPU power management for a specific architecture. Without this option selected, no CPU power management will be performed.

MMULESS_KERNEL.description: This VSB option provides the option to use MMU-less kernel.

PERTASK_CWD.description: This option enables task private current working directory feature in kernel space. A private CWD will be created for a kernel task only if this VSB option is enabled and the task option VX_PRIVATE_CWD is set for the task, otherwise the kernel's global CWD is used.

USER_IDENTIFICATION_INHERITANCE.description: This option enables the acquisition and inheritance of user identification attributes by tasks and RTPs. This is a Security option.

FILE_CREATION_MASK.description: This option enables the file mode creation mask.

RANDOM_ENTROPY_INJECT.description: This feature will turn on creating entropy and should only be used if using a software random number generator. Enabling this configuration option will quickly generate enough entropy in order to generate cryptographically strong random numbers. However, this configuration option will have a performance impact during interrupt calls. Using this configuration option with a hardware number generator, i.e. no calls to the SW random number lib will be made, will still add a small, but unnecessary, performance hit during interrupt calls. The random number generator is dependent on having the OPENSSL layer installed.

INTLOCKED_KERNEL_STATE.summary: Enable interrupt locking while the kernel lock is held
INTLOCKED_KERNEL_STATE.description: This option enables interrupt locking while the kernel lock is held in SMP.

INTLOCKED_KERNEL_STATE_LOCK_INT_ALL.description: This option selects all the maskable interrupts are locked.

KPTI.description: This option enables the Kernel Page Table Isolation (KPTI) for RTPs. KPTI is useful for mitigating certain security vulnerabilities, such as attacks utilizing speculative execution and indirect branch prediction to disclose information via a side-channel analysis of the data cache.

DUAL_MODE_TTY.description: This feature enables dual mode (interrupt and polled mode) TTY driver support. By default, only interrupt mode is supported.

USER_MODE_IOS.description: This feature enables user mode I/O system support. It is necessary for user mode I/O system driver, user mode file systems, and user mode sockets support.

FD_SET_SIZE.description: Minimum value for FD_SETSIZE, which controls the size of the fd_set structure used in select(). If NET_SOCK_MAX is also defined, the actual value for FD_SETSIZE will be the maximum of this parameter and NET_SOCK_MAX.

NAMESPACES.description: This option enables support for VxWorks namespaces. Namespaces provide separation and resource isolation for RTPs. Groups of RTPs may share a namespace.

DEFAULT_PTHREAD_PRIO_INHERIT.summary: PTHREAD_PRIO_INHERIT is the default user pthread mutex protocol.
DEFAULT_PTHREAD_PRIO_INHERIT.description: When this option is chosen every pthread mutex created in an RTP will default to the priority inheritance protocol. Otherwise the the mutex creation will default to no protocol. This option is recommended when using a generic OS abstraction layer, (like boost threads,) that may not consider priority preemptive scheduling in its design and thus be prone to priority inversion. Priority protocols are recommended in all cases, but do add additional overhead to mutex processing. Selective use with pthread_mutexattr_setprotocol() is the alternative for device specific designs where the system is well understood.

SECURE_COPROC_REGS.summary: Scrub kernel context or other process coprocessor registers before returning back or resume to user-land
SECURE_COPROC_REGS.description: With hard floating-point or other coprocessor enabled in the VxWorks kernel, an RTP application code is prevented from reading coprocessor register values set during kernel space or other process's computations. Without this, malicious applications could gain access to sensitive information. For systems where the security aspect is not a concern, this option can be disabled, resulting in some performance gain for system calls and task context switch.

AUTO_FP_TASK.summary: enable VX_FP_TASK option for all tasks
AUTO_FP_TASK.description: By enabling this option, all kernel and RTP tasks are created with the VX_FP_TASK option enabled.

AUTO_VECTOR.description: By enabling this option, all RTP tasks are created with the VX_FP_TASK option enabled. All RTPs and user libraries generated by this VSB project are built with compiler setting that allows for automatic vectorization.

MMAP_SHARED_ADRS.summary: Enable mmap() to return same address for multile mmaps calls with same file offset. (For Backward compatibility)
MMAP_SHARED_ADRS.description: This option provides backward compatibility for mmap() to return the same address for multiple mmap calls from within an RTP/Kernel using the same file offset. Note: This is provided as a temporary feature untill migration to use the new feature where mmap will return a new virtual address for ever call to mmap() even if a mapping alread exists for that file offset. Enabling this option results in non-POSIX behavior. This option will be removed in a future release

KERNEL_GLOBAL_ATOMIC_ACCESS.summary: Enable Kernel Global Variable Atomical access
KERNEL_GLOBAL_ATOMIC_ACCESS.description: This option enables accessing CPU-specific kernel variables for the current CPU without beforehand locking interrupts and fetching the address of the WIND_VARS block of the current CPU into a local pointer. This requires that the architecture maintains a CPU-specific pointer to each CPU's WIND_VARS in a reserved CPU register or CPU segment(x86), and that the required accesses can be done in one instruction, avoiding the possibility of CPU migration between instructions. The architecture that supports this option currently are ARMv8a and x86; and for that architecture it is enabled automatically unless the CERT VSB option is enabled. For CERT configurations, we disallow this feature to avoid complicating code requiring certification.

TIME_T_LONG_LONG.summary: Enable long long definition of time_t to support Year 2038 compliance
TIME_T_LONG_LONG.description: This option allows the type definition of time_t to be of long long. The option is necessary to support Year 2038 compliance.

KASAN.description: This option enable Kernel Address Sanitizer to detect memory issues

VX_KERNEL_TAG.summary: Set a specific tag name for VxWorks kernel image
VX_KERNEL_TAG.description: This option sets a specific tag name for VxWorks kernel image, the default is `VXW' in VxWorks 21.03 release or later while it used to be `VXW7' in older release. The tag must be changed to `VXW7' to build VxWorks image loadable from VxWorks bootApp built in a release older than VxWorks 21.03.

KERNEL_SSP.description: This option enables kernel stack smashing protection.

KERNEL_STACK_PROTECTOR.description: Compiler emits extra code to check for buffer overflows, such as stack smashing attacks. This is done by adding a guard variable to functions with vulnerable objects. This includes functions that call alloca, and functions with buffers larger than or equal to 8 bytes. The guards are initialized when a function is entered and then checked when the function exits. If a guard check fails, an error message is printed and the program exits. Only variables that are actually allocated on the stack are considered, optimized away variables or variables allocated in registers donâ€™t count.

KERNEL_STACK_PROTECTOR_EXPLICIT.description: Like -fstack-protector but only protects those functions which have the stack_protect attribute.

KERNEL_STACK_PROTECTOR_STRONG.description: Like -fstack-protector but includes additional functions to be protected â€? those that have local array definitions, or have references to local frame addresses. Only variables that are actually allocated on the stack are considered, optimized away variables or variables allocated in registers donâ€™t count.

KERNEL_STACK_PROTECTOR_ALL.description: Like -fstack-protector except that all functions are protected.

RTP_SSP.description: This option enables RTP stack smashing protection for all RTPs built against the VSB project.

RTP_STACK_PROTECTOR.description: Compiler emits extra code to check for buffer overflows, such as stack smashing attacks. This is done by adding a guard variable to functions with vulnerable objects. This includes functions that call alloca, and functions with buffers larger than or equal to 8 bytes. The guards are initialized when a function is entered and then checked when the function exits. If a guard check fails, an error message is printed and the program exits. Only variables that are actually allocated on the stack are considered, optimized away variables or variables allocated in registers donâ€™t count.

RTP_STACK_PROTECTOR_EXPLICIT.description: Like -fstack-protector but only protects those functions which have the stack_protect attribute.

RTP_STACK_PROTECTOR_STRONG.description: Like -fstack-protector but includes additional functions to be protected â€? those that have local array definitions, or have references to local frame addresses. Only variables that are actually allocated on the stack are considered, optimized away variables or variables allocated in registers donâ€™t count.

RTP_STACK_PROTECTOR_ALL.description: Like -fstack-protector except that all functions are protected.

XLNX_ZYNQ_2_0_6_1.description: This provides the Xilinx Zynq processor support libraries (PSL).

DEBUG_2_0_3_3.description: This provides libraries CORE_DUMP and VXDBG.

DEBUG_2_0_3_3_SYSTEMVIEWER_2_0_3_3.description: This provides the low-level event points for VxWorks System Viewer, Runtime Analysis and generic lightweight data collectors,including dataCollectorLib and rBuff.

SV_INSTRUMENTATION.description: This option enables the System Viewer instrumentation support. When selected, specific points in the VxWorks kernel source will be instrumented for debugging with System Viewer, e.g. semaphore give and take operations. Once a system has been debugged, this option may be de-selected, which removes instrumentation in performance critical APIs that will reduce footprint and improve performance for these critical APIs. When this option is de-selected, the INCLUDE_WINDVIEW component in a VxWorks Image Project (VIP) will not work and may not be configured.

RTTOOLS_2_0_1_7_DEBUG_AGENT_2_0_1_7.description: This is the VxWorks Debug Agent that provides a modular service-based communication system for building control, debug, and analysis tools for VxWorks. This agent is based on the Target Communication Framework protocol (http://www.eclipse.org/tcf/).

TCF_GDB_RSP.summary: Start GDB Remote Serial Protocol server

RTTOOLS_2_0_1_7_RUNTIME_ANALYSIS_2_0_1_7.description: Analysis tools allow user to do target profiling, monitoring and memory analysis. Depends on the Debug Agent as communication facility.

RTTOOLS_2_0_1_7_STOP_MODE_DEBUG_AGENT_2_.description: This provides the VxWorks Stop Mode Debug Agent.

RTTOOLS_2_0_1_7_SYSTEMVIEWER_AGENT_2_0_1.description: VxWorks System Viewer provides detailed analysis and graphical visualization of VxWorks system events, revealing the complex interactions of tasks, interrupts, and system objects of an application executing on a target. VxWorks System Viewer Agent provides live communication support for host tools to configure, control and collect System Viewer Logs. Depends on the Debug Agent as communication facility.

UTILS_2_0_8_0.description: This layer provides various OS utilities

BOARDLIB_NO_PROBE.summary: Board library without board probe model enabled
BOARDLIB_NO_PROBE.description: Enabling this option removes board probe operation from the board library initialization routine. At this time, _pBspBoardFuncTbl must be defined for one board, and the board need not be added to the board library by VX_BOARD_DEF.

UTILS_2_0_8_0_BOOTAPP_2_0_8_0.description: This provides the VxWorks kernel bootapp library.

UTILS_2_0_8_0_DEPLOY_2_0_8_0.description: This layer enables support for VxWorks library/udb deployment.

UDB_NONE.summary: Deployment will not provide a user database file

UDB_COPY.summary: Deployment will use the user database file selected by UDB_COPY_PATH

UDB_COPY_PATH.summary: Host path to user database file to use when deploying

UTILS_2_0_8_0_LOADER_2_0_8_0.description: This provides the VxWorks loader library.

BRANCH_ISLAND_SUPPORT.summary: Enable Branch Island support for DKM loader
BRANCH_ISLAND_SUPPORT.description: Enabling this option will solve relocation range error that may occur while downloading DKM, that is not handled for long calls by either compiler or linker. (Only supported on ARM64, so far.) This feature does not cover the relocation range error for data access. DKM still needs to be compiled for large code model, such as with -mcmodel=large, to avoid it.

UTILS_2_0_8_0_OSTOOLS_2_0_8_0.description: This provides various VxWorks OS tools (symbol table, spy, timex, tip, repeat/period, etc).

UTILS_2_0_8_0_RBUFF_2_0_8_0.description: This provides VxWorks kernel ring buffer support.

UTILS_2_0_8_0_RUST_2_0_8_0.description: This layer creates an environment in which to do Rust programming

UTILS_2_0_8_0_SHELL_2_0_8_0.description: This provides the VxWorks kernel shell.

UTILS_2_0_8_0_UNIX_2_0_8_0.description: A collection of additional Unix functions typically used by open source libraries.The Unix Compatibility layer is provided to enable building specific versions of open source packages.Recipe layers for these open source packages are avalible on Wind River Github.The Unix layer does not provide POSIX compliance, and there is no guarantee of specific behavior.

UTILS_2_0_8_0_UTF_2_0_8_0.description: This library provides unicode character set support.

UTILS_2_0_8_0_UUID_2_0_8_0.description: This library provides functions to generate and work with universally unique identifiers.

UTILS_2_0_8_0_WRCC_2_0_8_0.description: This layer enables support for the wr-cc toolchain adapter.

SERVICE_4_0_1_1.description: This is a container for EPOLL, ERF, JOBQUEUE, RPC, SOCKET and UN.

SERVICE_4_0_1_1_EPOLL_4_0_1_1.description: This provides the VxWorks EPOLL facility, a scalable I/O event notification mechanism. Currently EPOLL supports IPNET sockets only, not other file descriptors.

POLL_ALL_ENTRIES.summary: Enable checking all entries in the epoll instance at epoll_wait
POLL_ALL_ENTRIES.description: When enabled, the epoll checks all the entries in the epoll instance, but only polls the file descriptors that have events or need to be polled for level-triggered monitoring at epoll_wait. The macro is defined by default to get better performance when lot of monitored file descriptors have concurrent events. When disabled, two ready linked lists are used: one to track devices which have events, one to deliver events to applications. A mutex semaphore is used to protect the ready list to track device events. Opposite to enabling, this should only be disabled in case of a lot of monitored file descriptors, but few have concurrent events.

EPOLL_IPNET_SOCK_USE_SIGNALS.summary: Register/Deregister the socket event watch through IPNET pipe signal
EPOLL_IPNET_SOCK_USE_SIGNALS.description: When disabled, epoll directly registers/de-registers the event watch in a socket -- adding/removing a monitored socket to/from the epoll list directly in the Ipnet_socket structure, protected by the mutex semaphore. This is disabled by default, assuming one socket is polled by one/few epolls in the most common scenario. When enabled, epoll registers/de-registers the event watch through IPNET pipe signal without the mutext semaphore. Enable this if a socket is polled by multiple epolls.

SERVICE_4_0_1_1_ERF_4_0_1_1.description: This library provides Event Reporting Framework support that permits other libraries access to report events in a standard way.

SERVICE_4_0_1_1_JOBQUEUE_4_0_1_1.description: This module implements a class of object representing a prioritized queue of jobs to be executed by a single task, the 'job server', associated with the job queue object.

SERVICE_4_0_1_1_RPC_4_0_1_1.description: This provides support for remote procedure call (RPC) 4.0.

SERVICE_4_0_1_1_SOCKET_4_0_1_1.description: This provides UNIX BSD 4.4 compatible socket calls.

USER_MODE_SOCKET.description: This feature enables user mode sockets support.

SERVICE_4_0_1_1_UN_4_0_1_1.description: This layer provides sockets in the local domain (AF_LOCAL). Local domain socket names are implemented over the Connection-Oriented Message Passing (COMP) protocol. This protocol provides an optimized transport relative to AF_INET/AF_INET6 for applications that use the socket API to communicate between tasks that are executing on the same node. This intra-node method is also able to communicate between RTPs and the kernel, or between tasks executing in different RTPs.

ACPI_6_1_0_2.description: This layer provides the Advanced Configuration and Power Interface (ACPI) Component Architecture (ACPICA) libraries.

FDT_2_0_2_2.description: This provides the VxWorks flattened device tree (FDT) libraries.

PSCI_1_0_0_0.description: This library provides support for the VxWorks Power State Coordination Interface (PSCI).

PROFILES_1_0_2_0.description: This layer provides matching VSB and VIP profiles.

GUEST_SUPPORT_VX7_1_0_1_3.description: These libraries provide the Hypervisor guest support functionality.

GUEST_SUPPORT_VX7_1_0_1_3_DSS_1_0_1_3.description: This layer provides the Debug Socket Support (DSS) driver for the VxWorks hypervisor environment.

GUEST_SUPPORT_VX7_1_0_1_3_HVIF_1_0_1_3.description: This layer provides the interface API to communicate with the hypervisor kernel.

GUEST_SUPPORT_VX7_1_0_1_3_SHMEM_1_0_1_3.description: This layer provides the Shared Memory driver for the VxWorks hypervisor environment.

HYPERVISOR_SHMEM.summary: Enable Hypervisor Shared Memory guest support
HYPERVISOR_SHMEM.description: This option allows the user to add the hypervisor shared memory feature to the guest.

GUEST_SUPPORT_VX7_1_0_1_3_SYSTEMVIEWER_1.description: This layer provides the System Viewer (SYSTEMVIEWER) driver for the VxWorks hypervisor environment.

GUEST_SUPPORT_VX7_1_0_1_3_THROTTLE_1_0_1.description: This layer provides the Throttle APIs

GUEST_SUPPORT_VX7_1_0_1_3_VIRTIO_1_0_1_3.description: VirtIO is a platform-agnostic framework for fully virtualized devices from the OASIS open specification in progress at http://www.oasis-open.org/committees/virtio

VIRTIO_MMIO.description: VxBus virtio MMIO support. This layer provides the virtio device via MMIO bus interface.

VIRTIO_NATIVE.description: Build VIRTIO from VxWorks native instead of helix.

GUEST_SUPPORT_VX7_1_0_1_3_VNIC_1_0_1_3.description: This layer provides the Virtual Network Interface Card (VNIC) driver for the VxWorks hypervisor environment.

GUEST_SUPPORT_VX7_BENCHMARKS_2_0_0_6.description: These libraries provide guest-level benchmark test code for the hypervisor.

GUEST_SUPPORT_VX7_SAFE_1_0_3_6.description: These libraries provide hypervisor guest safety support.

HELIX_CERT.description: This option enables the HELIX CERT Subset

HELIX_CERT_DEBUG.description: This option enables the HELIX CERT Subset plus additional code for debugging

WV_APEX_INSTRUMENTATION.description: This feature enables instrumenting APEX for WindView. By default, this option is enabled.

GUEST_SUPPORT_VX7_SAFE_1_0_3_6_HM_1_0_3_.description: This layer provides the health monitoring code.

GUEST_SUPPORT_VX7_SAFE_1_0_3_6_HVIF_1_0_.description: This layer provides the hypervisor interface API.

GUEST_SUPPORT_VX7_SAFE_1_0_3_6_SAFEIPC_1.description: This layer provides Safe IPC (inter-process communication) support.

AMIO.description: This feature enables AMIO support. By default, this option is enabled.

GUEST_SUPPORT_VX7_SAFE_1_0_3_6_SAFEIPC_1.description: This layer provides SOCKET support for safe IPC.

CONTAINER_1_0_1_0.description: This layer provides various container services.

CONTAINER_PYTHON_WEB_SERVER.description: This option enables creation of a container example for a Python web server. Requires Buildah installed on the build computer.

CONTAINER_PYTHON_HELLO.description: This option enables creation of a container example for a Python web server. Requires Buildah installed on the build computer.

CONTAINER_PYTHON_PANDAS.description: This option enables creation of a container example for a Python Pandas. Requires Buildah installed on the build computer.

CONTAINER_1_0_1_0_MANAGER_1_0_0_1.description: This layer provides the runtime manager for container images.

DOCKER_REGISTRY_HTTP_API_V2.summary: Generic Docker Registry HTTP API V2
DOCKER_REGISTRY_HTTP_API_V2.description: This option enables the registry that follows Generic Docker Registry HTTP API V2

CONTAINER_1_0_1_0_RUNTIME_1_0_1_0.description: This layer provides container runtime support.

CONTAINER_UZLIB.description: This option selects uzlib as the uncompress implementation used by the container runtime. If this option is disabled, zlib is used; in this case zlib (ZLIB) has to be added excplicitly.

CONTAINER_OPENSSL_SHA.description: This option selects openssl sha algorithms as hash algorithms used by the container runtime. If this option is disabled, mbedtls sha algorithms are used.

CRYPTOMISC_2_0_2_6.description: This provides support for miscellaneous encryption libraries.

CRYPTOMISC_2_0_2_6_IAF_2_0_2_6.description: This provides support for Information Assurance Framework (IAF).

CRYPTOMISC_2_0_2_6_IPFREESCALE_2_0_2_6.description: This provides support for Freescale cryptographic hardware.

CRYPTOMISC_2_0_2_6_IPHWCRYPTO_2_0_2_6.description: This provides support for cryptography hardware.

CRYPTOMISC_2_0_2_6_TPM_2_0_2_6.description: These libraries provide support for Trusted Platform Module (TPM).

DISK_ENCRYPTION_2_0_1_2.description: VxWorks full disk encryption provides data at rest protection for sector-addressable devices (like hard disks), using the XEX-AES algorithm. The feature encrypts the data on specified partitions of the storage devices. It uses the VxWorks secure vault facility to store the symmetric encryption keys. The dosFs and HRFS file systems are supported for full disk encryption.

LDAPC_2_4_47_0.description: These libraries provide the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) support.

OP_TEE_2_3_0_2.description: OP-TEE Client API provides the TEE Client API as defined by the GlobalPlatform TEE standard.

OPENSSL_FIPS_2_0_13_6.description: (No Longer Supported) These libraries provide OpenSSL FIPS 140-2 support.

SECURE_LOADER_2_0_2_6.description: This provides support for secure loading of downloadable kernel modules (DKMs), real-time processes (RTPs), and shared libraries using digital signature checking.

SECURE_LOADER_PRIVATE_PK_FILE.description: The private PK file points to a file that contains the private PK in Privacy Enhanced Mail (PEM) format. The private PK is the private key used for signing the Key Exchange Key (KEK) on the platform in secure mode. If this file does not exist, a new file is generated with a private PK.

SECURE_LOADER_PUBLIC_PK_CERT_FILE.description: The public PK certificate file points to a file that contains the public PK certificate in Privacy Enhanced Mail (PEM) format. The public PK certificate is used for validating the KEK on the platform in secure mode. If this file does not exist, a new file is generated with a public PK certificate.

SECURE_LOADER_PRIVATE_KEK_FILE.description: The private KEK file points to a file that contains the private KEK in Privacy Enhanced Mail (PEM) format. The private KEK is used for signing the signature database on the platform in secure mode. If this file does not exist, a new file is generated with a private KEK.

SECURE_LOADER_PUBLIC_KEK_CERT_FILE.summary: Public Key Exchange Key (KEK) certificate file
SECURE_LOADER_PUBLIC_KEK_CERT_FILE.description: The public KEK certificate file points to a file that contains the public KEK certificate in Privacy Enhanced Mail (PEM) format. The public KEK certificate is used for validating the signature database on the platform in secure mode. If this file does not exist, a new file is generated with a public KEK certificate.

SECURE_LOADER_PRIVATE_SIGNING_KEY_FILE.description: The private signing key file points to a file that contains the private signing key in Privacy Enhanced Mail (PEM) format. The private signing key is used for signing and validating signed images on the platform in secure mode. If this file does not exist, a new file is generated with a private signing key.

SECURE_LOADER_PUBLIC_SIGNING_CERT_FILE.description: The public signing certificate file points to a file that contains the public signing certificate in Privacy Enhanced Mail (PEM) format. The public signing certificate is used for validating signed images on the platform in secure mode. If this file does not exist, a new file is generated with a public signing certificate.

SECURE_LOADER_SIG_RSA.description: When selected, this option enables RSA as the signing algorithm that is used to sign the image.

SECURE_LOADER_STRIP.description: When enabled, this feature strips the the image before encrypting and signing the image.

SECURE_LOADER_ENCRYPTION.summary: Enable encryption and decryption of image
SECURE_LOADER_ENCRYPTION.description: When enabled, this feature encrypts the image before signing the image, and requires decrypting the encrypted image before loading the image that includes VxWorks images, DKMs, RTPs, and shared libraries.

SECURE_LOADER_KEP_SECRET.description: The key-encryption password (KEP) secret in secSecret that is used to generate the key-encryption key and key-encryption initialization vector for encrypting and decrypting the decrypt-info. The decrypt-info contains the decryption keys for decrypting the encrypted image before loading the image.

SECURE_LOADER_KEP_ID.description: The key-encryption password (KEP) ID in secSecret that is used to identify the KEP secret in secSecret.

SECURE_LOADER_CIPHER_AES_128_CTR.description: When selected, this option enables AES-128 CTR as the cipher algorithm that is used to encrypt the image.

SECURE_LOADER_CIPHER_AES_256_CTR.description: When selected, this option enables AES-256 CTR as the cipher algorithm that is used to encrypt the image.

SECURE_LOADER_DIGEST_SHA1.description: When selected, this option enables SHA1 as the message digest that is used to derive the key from the KEP secret.

SECURE_LOADER_DIGEST_SHA256.description: When selected, this option enables SHA256 as the message digest that is used to derive the key from the KEP secret.

SECURITY_EVENT_3_0_0_0.description: These libraries provide support for a centralized security event handler.

SECURITY_MISC_2_0_2_5.description: Container for SCEP, SEC_CRYPTO, and SEC_HASH APIs.

SECURITY_MISC_2_0_2_5_SCEP_2_0_2_5.description: This provides IPNet Simple Certificate Enrollment Protocol (SCEP) support.

SECURITY_MISC_2_0_2_5_SEC_CRYPTO_2_0_2_5.description: VxWorks encryption API. This code provides a VxWorks API for security features, such as encryption and protected storage. Different implementations of encryption algorithms can be plugged in without affecting the user of the APIs. No encryption algorithm implementations are included in the SEC_CRYPTO code. The Wind River-provided implementations are based on OpenSSL and are placed in the OPENSSL layer. When using the SEC_CRYPTO encryption API, you must include OPENSSL or provide your own set of encryption algorithm implementations. If you provide your own set of encryption algorithm implementations, you can disable the WR implementation by setting the WR_OPENSSL_DISABLED flag.

SECURITY_MISC_2_0_2_5_SEC_HASH_2_0_2_5.description: VxWorks Hash, HMAC and PBKDF2 API. Provides a VxWorks API for hash algorithms, hmac and pbkdf2.

USER_MANAGEMENT_2_0_1_7.description: These libraries provide VxWorks user management and login features.When enabled this feature adds the user management and login features to a VxWorks Source Build project. Switching VxWorks to its Security mode requires including the INCLUDE_SECURITY component in a VxWorks Image Project based on that VSB. Once this component is included users will have to be registered in order to log on the system. User registration requires setting up VxWorks user database on a file system available to the target. See also the configuration parameters associated with the INCLUDE_USER_IDENTIFICATION and INCLUDE_USER_DATABASE components.

USER_MANAGEMENT_2_0_1_7_LDAP_2_0_1_7.description: Provides Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) and Active Directory (AD) authentication.

USER_MANAGEMENT_2_0_1_7_POLICY_2_0_1_7.description: User management policy features. When enabled this feature adds the possibility to add password change and login policies.

USER_MANAGEMENT_2_0_1_7_USER_PRIVILEGES_.description: This provides VxWorks user privileges feature. When enabled this feature adds the user privilege verification support to a VxWorks Source Build project. To benefit from privilege verification, VxWorks must be set in Security mode (requires including the INCLUDE_SECURITY component in a VxWorks Image Project based on that VSB) and users must be registered in the VxWorks user database.

CAN_2_0_5_0.description: The Controller Area Network (CAN) package provides support for Socket CAN and CAN controller driver.

IEEE1394_2_0_2_2.description: This provides the IEEE 1394 driver and stack.

USB_2_0_8_0.description: This includes all Universal Serial Bus (USB) support.

USB_DEBUG_ENABLE.description: This option provides the ability to enable the USB debug function.

USB_2_0_8_0_CTLR_2_0_8_0.description: This includes support for different USB hardware controller drivers.

USB_2_0_8_0_CTLR_2_0_8_0_CDNSUSB3_2_0_8_.description: This provides Cadence USBSS-DRD controller support.

USB_2_0_8_0_CTLR_2_0_8_0_DWC2DR_2_0_8_0.description: This provides the synopsys DesignWare series USB 2.0 host controller device support.

USB_2_0_8_0_CTLR_2_0_8_0_EHCI_2_0_8_0.description: This provides enhanced host controller interface (EHCI) host controller support.

EHCI_IMX6_SDIS_MODE.summary: Enable stream disable mode for i.MX6
EHCI_IMX6_SDIS_MODE.description: This option provides the ability to enable the Stream Disable Mode.

USB_2_0_8_0_CTLR_2_0_8_0_FSLDR_2_0_8_0.description: This provides Freescale USB Dual-Role controller support.

FSLDR_SDIS_MODE.description: This option provides the ability to enable the Stream Disable Mode.

USB_2_0_8_0_CTLR_2_0_8_0_MHDRC_2_0_8_0.description: This is used for MHDRC controller support. This controller has the host, target and OTG functions, but depends on the specific BSP.

USB_2_0_8_0_CTLR_2_0_8_0_OHCI_2_0_8_0.description: This provides open host controller interface (OHCI) host controller support.

USB_2_0_8_0_CTLR_2_0_8_0_PCHUDC_2_0_8_0.description: This provides Intel USB controller support.

USB_2_0_8_0_CTLR_2_0_8_0_PLX_2_0_8_0.description: This provides PLX target controller support.

USB_2_0_8_0_CTLR_2_0_8_0_RZN1_2_0_8_0.description: This provides the Rensas RZ/N1 USB host/target controller support.

USB_2_0_8_0_CTLR_2_0_8_0_UHCI_2_0_8_0.description: This provides universal host controller interface (UHCI) host controller support.

USB_2_0_8_0_CTLR_2_0_8_0_USBDWC3_2_0_8_0.description: This provides DesignWare USB3 DRD controller support.

USB_2_0_8_0_CTLR_2_0_8_0_XHCI_2_0_8_0.description: This provides extensible host controller interface (XHCI) host controller support.

USB_2_0_8_0_HOST_2_0_8_0.description: This provides all the USB host side drivers.

USB_2_0_8_0_HOST_2_0_8_0_NETWORK_2_0_8_0.description: This provides USB network class driver support. This is the host side driver.

USB_2_0_8_0_HOST_2_0_8_0_STORAGE_2_0_8_0.description: This provides mass storage class driver support. This is the host side driver.

USB_2_0_8_0_HOST_2_0_8_0_TOUCHSCREEN_2_0.description: This provides USB touchscreen class driver support. This is the host side driver.

USB_2_0_8_0_OTG_2_0_8_0.description: This is used for USB OTG support. This will be selected automatically if the controller driver supports the on-the-go (OTG) function, such as MHDRC controller driver.

USB_2_0_8_0_PHY_2_0_8_0.description: This contains the USB PHY drivers.

USB_2_0_8_0_TARGET_2_0_8_0.description: This provides all the USB target side drivers.

USB_2_0_8_0_TARGET_2_0_8_0_MSC_2_0_8_0.description: This provides USB mass storage function driver support. This is the target side driver.

USB_2_0_8_0_TARGET_2_0_8_0_NET_2_0_8_0.description: This provides USB network function driver support. This is the target side driver.

USB_2_0_8_0_TYPEC_2_0_8_0.description: This contains the USB Type-C drivers.

BDM_2_0_8_0.description: This provides block device management (BDM) file system support. Includes extended block device (XBD) support.

BDM_XBD.description: This provides extended block device (XBD) support.

BDM_2_0_8_0_FLASH_2_0_8_0.description: This provides block device managers support (MTD) for various flash storage devices.

TFFS_HIGH_FAULT_TOLERANCE.description: Achieving higher fault tolerance by,never writing in-place, double BAM, checksum of user data.

TFFS_TRUE_STATIC_WL.description: Enable true static wear-leveling to distribute erase across the, whole flash device as evenly as possible.

TFFS_BACKGROUND_TASK.description: Enabled background task for defragment when system is idle.

NAND_FLASH_ECC_FORMAT.description: This option specifies the format of the ECC related information on NAND FLASH devices. A value of 0 (default) specifies the format originally supported in VxWorks 7. A value of 1 specifies a format to support devices with advanced hardware ECC capabilities. The formats are not compatible, i.e. a VxWorks kernel configured with NAND_FLASH_ECC_FORMAT=1 will not be able to read/write from a FLASH device previously formatted with the original format. Reformatting a FLASH device will result in any existing data/files to be lost. When reformatting a FLASH device with NAND_FLASH_ECC_FORMAT=1 on a device formatted with the original format, the error message failed to read data from chip may appear at the shell; it can be safely ignored.

BDM_2_0_8_0_FLASH_2_0_8_0_SIM_2_0_8_0.description: This library provides a unified and flexible solution for simulating flash devices, so as to assist the development and sustaining of flash-specific software.

BDM_2_0_8_0_LOOPFS_2_0_8_0.description: This provides Loop File System driver.

BDM_2_0_8_0_NVME_2_0_8_0.description: This provides various NVM Express drivers.

BDM_2_0_8_0_NVRAM_2_0_8_0.description: This provides various Non-Volatile RAM drivers.

BDM_2_0_8_0_SATA_2_0_8_0.description: This provides various SATA controller drivers.

SATA_TRIM.description: This option enables to support SATA TRIM function. If set to n , TRIM function is forcibly disabled.

SATA_DETECT_POLLING.summary: Enable SATA detection in polling mode
SATA_DETECT_POLLING.description: This option enables SATA device's detection by polling mode. If set to y , the default interrupt detection is forcibly disabled.

SATA_TASK_FILE_ERROR_INTERRUPT.summary: Enable SATA TaskFile Error interrupt and recovery handler
SATA_TASK_FILE_ERROR_INTERRUPT.description: This option enables AHCI controller TaskFile Error interrupt and its recovery handler. If set to y , the default interrupt handler is enabled.

SATA_AUTO_USE_PIO.summary: Enable SATA PIO mode when DMA fails
SATA_AUTO_USE_PIO.description: This option enables SATA automatically to use PIO mode when DMA transfer fails. If set to n , do not use PIO mode and report error directly when DMA transfer fails.

FS_2_1_4_0.description: This contains support for various file systems (FS).

MAX_DEVNAME.description: This option configures maximum device name length.

NFS3_RWOPT.description: This option provides the ability to optimize read/write procedure in NFS3 server. It is cautious that some NFS3 client version on Linux or Unix may not work if it is turned on.

NFS3_BLKSIZE_FACTOR.summary: Set factor for maximum block size transferred in NFS3 server
NFS3_BLKSIZE_FACTOR.description: This option provides a factor to configure maximum block size that can be tranfered by NFS3 server. The block size equals to the factor multiplied by 8192 bytes. A bigger factor will cost more memory. small value may cause package lost in network stack.

DOSFS_NAME_LENGTH_COMPAT.summary: set dosFS to be compatible with Windows FAT32 naming rules for file/directory name length
DOSFS_NAME_LENGTH_COMPAT.description: This option enable dosFs to be compatible with Windows FAT32 naming rules for file/directory name length.

XBD_GPT_SUPPORT.summary: Enable or disable GPT partition table support
XBD_GPT_SUPPORT.description: This option enable or disable GPT partition table support

FS_2_1_4_0_CDROMFS_2_0_0_6.description: These libraries implement the CD-ROM file system.

FS_2_1_4_0_DOSFS_2_0_1_6.description: This library implements the MS-DOS compatible DOS file system.

COMPONENT_IPMCP.description: This option controls whether the system should include a multicast proxy that operates according to RFC 4605. A multicast proxy is a simple variant of a multicast routing daemon. A multicast proxy will learn which groups that has at least one listener through the Internet Group Management Protocol (IGMP) and/or Multicast Listener Discovery (MLD) membership information. Multicast traffic sent to group G received on one link will be forwarded to all other links that has listener on group G. IGMP will be enabled if the system is configured for IPv4 and/or MLD if it is configured or IPv6.

BOOST_1_75_0_0.description: Boost provides free peer-reviewed portable C++ source libraries. This layer enables boost for VxWorks.

BOOST_RTP.description: Enable boost libraries to be used in RTPs

BOOST_BUILD_ALL_SHARED.description: Build all boost libraries that are not header-only as shared libraries.

BOOST_BUILD_NO_SHARED.description: Build all boost library that are not header-only as static libraries

BOOST_CONTAINER.description: The most of library is header only, the compiled portion is only for a couple features. The container library implements several well-known containers, including STL containers. The aim of this library is to offer advanced features not present in standard containers, or to offer the latest standard draft features. https://www.boost.org/doc/libs/1_75_0/doc/html/container.html

BOOST_CONTRACT.description: Contract programming framework. A formal way of asserting code is functioning correctly in production. https://www.boost.org/doc/libs/1_75_0/libs/contract/doc/html/boost_contract/contract_programming_overview.html

BOOST_COROUTINE.description: Coroutine provides templates for generalized subroutines which allow suspending and resuming execution at certain locations. It preserves the local state of execution and allows re-entering subroutines more than once (useful if state must be kept across function calls). https://www.boost.org/doc/libs/1_75_0/libs/coroutine/doc/html/index.html

BOOST_EXCEPTION.description: The purpose of Boost Exception is to ease the design of exception class hierarchies and to help write exception handling and error reporting code. It supports transporting arbitrary data to the catch site, which is otherwise tricky due to the no-throw requirements for exception types. https://www.boost.org/doc/libs/1_75_0/libs/exception/doc/boost-exception.html

BOOST_FIBER.description: Fiber provides a framework for micro-/userland-threads (fibers) which are scheduled cooperatively. The API contains classes and functions to manage and synchronize fibers. https://www.boost.org/doc/libs/1_75_0/libs/fiber/doc/html/index.html

BOOST_FILESYSTEM.description: Filesystem library provides facilities to manipulate files and directories, and the paths that identify them. https://www.boost.org/doc/libs/1_75_0/libs/filesystem/doc/index.htm

BOOST_GRAPH.description: Graphs are mathematical abstractions that are useful for solving many types of problems in computer science. The graph library provides the ability to represent and manipulate graphs, as well as common graph algorithms, like BFS, DFS, shortest-path algorithms, and minimum spanning tree algorithms. https://www.boost.org/doc/libs/1_75_0/libs/graph/doc/index.html

BOOST_IOSTREAMS.description: Iostreams makes it easy to create standard C++ streams and stream buffers for accessing new Sources and Sinks. And provides a framework for defining Filters and attaching them to standard streams and stream buffers. https://www.boost.org/doc/libs/1_75_0/libs/iostreams/doc/index.html

BOOST_JSON.description: Json allows you to serialize and deserialize programmatic data structures to and from files. Storing and reading information in this format is ubiquitous for sharing information easily between endpoints, and between applications and scripts written in different programming languages. https://www.boost.org/doc/libs/1_75_0/libs/json/doc/html/index.html

BOOST_LOCALE.description: Locale is a library that provides high quality localization facilities in a C++ way. It requires the ICU (International Components for Unicode) as a back end. https://www.boost.org/doc/libs/1_75_0/libs/locale/doc/html/index.html

BOOST_LOG.description: This library aims to make logging significantly easier for the application developer. It provides a wide range of out-of-the-box tools along with public interfaces for extending the library. https://www.boost.org/doc/libs/1_75_0/libs/log/doc/html/index.html

BOOST_MATH.description: The math library provides a wide range of parts: floating point utilities, mathematical constants, a set of statistical distributions, special mathematical functions (gamma, beta and erf functions), root finding and function minimization algorithms, tools to manipulate and evaluate polynomials and rational numbers, function interpolation, integration and differentiation routines, representations for quaternions and octonions, and automatic differentiation. https://www.boost.org/doc/libs/1_75_0/libs/math/doc/html/index.html

BOOST_NOWIDE.description: The nowide library makes cross-platform unicode-aware programming easier. https://www.boost.org/doc/libs/1_75_0/libs/nowide/doc/html/index.html

BOOST_PROGRAM_OPTIONS.description: The program options library allows application developers to easily obtain name value pairs from command-line input. The library helps reduce boiler-plate, error-prone code, as well as providing better error reporting for bad inputs. The usage message can be automatically generated, allowing it to be always up-to-date with the actual options. https://www.boost.org/doc/libs/1_75_0/doc/html/program_options.html

BOOST_RANDOM.description: The random library provides generators and statistical distributions to produce random numbers. The mersenne twister is used as the source of randomness, which has the property that the random numbers produced will be the same at each program run, given the starting seed is the same. https://www.boost.org/doc/libs/1_75_0/doc/html/boost_random.html

BOOST_REGEX.description: The regex library provides pattern matching through regular expressions. https://www.boost.org/doc/libs/1_75_0/libs/regex/doc/html/index.html

BOOST_SERIALIZATION.description: The serialization library allows serialization and deserialization of arbitrary C++ data structures to a sequence of bytes. The format can be binary data, text data, XML, or any user-defined format. https://www.boost.org/doc/libs/1_75_0/libs/serialization/doc/index.html

BOOST_SYSTEM.description: The system library gives a more portable way to deal with error codes across different operating systems. https://www.boost.org/doc/libs/1_75_0/libs/system/doc/html/system.html

BOOST_THREAD.description: The thread library enables the use of multiple threads of execution with shared data in portable C++ code. It provides classes and functions for managing the threads themselves, along with others for synchronizing data between the threads or providing separate copies of data specific to individual threads. https://www.boost.org/doc/libs/1_75_0/doc/html/thread.html

BOOST_TIMER.description: The timer library makes it easy to measure wall-clock time, user CPU time, and system CPU time. https://www.boost.org/doc/libs/1_75_0/libs/timer/doc/index.html

BOOST_TYPE_ERASURE.description: TypeErasure library provides runtime polymorphism in C++ that is more flexible than that provided by the core language. https://www.boost.org/doc/libs/1_75_0/doc/html/boost_typeerasure.html

BOOST_TELNET_ADDR.summary: IP Address of target to execute tests on
BOOST_TELNET_ADDR.description: If left blank the tests are just compiled, if specified an 'expect' script is used to telnet to the target and execute tests. The target must support telnet and have the host filesystem mounted in order to find the test RTPs. rlogin should be disabled and so no user login is required.

BOOST_HOST_FILEPATH_MAPPING_PREFIX.summary: Path prefix to access VSB workspace from target
BOOST_HOST_FILEPATH_MAPPING_PREFIX.description: The target needs to use one of several filesystems to access host in order to load the test executables, the default value is the valid when the TCF (debugger) connection is used. Other possibilities are NFS, FTP mounts which are typically <hostname>:

INTEL_MKL_COMPAT_STATIC.description: Install the mklcompat_static library, which should be used when creating static RTPs. Defaults to on.

ITLI915_4_8_0_16.description: This provides the Intel HD and Iris graphics driver.

JANSSON_2_12_1_0.description: This library provides support for JSON data.

KHRONOS_1_4_0_13.description: This provides the Khronos specification headers.

LIBARCHIVE_3_4_2_3.description: This layer provides the archive library that can read and write streaming archives in a variety of formats.

LIBCURL_7_71_1_1.description: cURL is a client-side URL transfer library with URL syntax, supporting a number of protocols.

LIBDRM_2_4_74_16.description: This provides the libDRM GPU driver support libraries and demos.

LIBFFI_3_3_1_2.description: libffi provides high level programming interface and is useful to build a bridge between interpreted and natively compiled code. libffi doesn't support soft floating point.

LIBJPEG_9_0_0_12.description: This provides the JPEG image processing library.

LIBPNG_1_6_37_1.description: This provides the PNG image processing library.

LZMA_5_2_5_2.description: XZ Utils is a free general-purpose data compression software with a high compression ratio.

MESA_MANGLE.description: When selected, this option mangles OpenGL APIs namespace or when not selected, this option does not mangle OpenGL APIs namespace.

MESA_GPUDEV_DRI_I965.summary: Mesa GPU Intel DRI i965 driver
MESA_GPUDEV_DRI_I965.description: When selected, this option enables Mesa GPU OpenGL APIs using Intel DRI i965 driver.

MESA_GPUDEV_INTEL_GEN_CPU.description: When selected, this option enables Intel Graphics based on the CPU of the BSP for the Mesa GPU Intel DRI i965 driver.

MESA_GPUDEV_INTEL_GEN60.description: When selected, this option enables Intel Graphics Gen6 (SandyBridge) for the Mesa GPU Intel DRI i965 driver.

MESA_GPUDEV_INTEL_GEN70.description: When selected, this option enables Intel Graphics Gen7 (IvyBridge/BayTrail) for the Mesa GPU Intel DRI i965 driver.

MESA_GPUDEV_INTEL_GEN75.description: When selected, this option enables Intel Graphics Gen7.5 (Haswell) for the Mesa GPU Intel DRI i965 driver.

MESA_GPUDEV_INTEL_GEN80.description: When selected, this option enables Intel Graphics Gen8 (Broadwell/Braswell/CherryTrail) for the Mesa GPU Intel DRI i965 driver.

MESA_GPUDEV_INTEL_GEN90.description: When selected, this option enables Intel Graphics Gen9 (Skylake/KabyLake/ApolloLake) for the Mesa GPU Intel DRI i965 driver.

MESA_DEBUG_FLAG.description: When selected, this option enables print out of debug messages by the Mesa library but may cause timing related problem to the Mesa library.

MIMALLOC_1_6_7_0.description: This layer provides mimalloc as an alternative heap manager.

MIMALLOC_AS_KERNEL_HEAP.summary: Enable mimalloc as the kernel heap manager
MIMALLOC_AS_KERNEL_HEAP.description: This option selects mimalloc as the kernel heap manager. Disable this option to fall back to the legacy kernel heap manager.

MIMALLOC_AS_RTP_HEAP.summary: Enable mimalloc as the RTP heap manager for all RTPs
MIMALLOC_AS_RTP_HEAP.description: This option selects mimalloc as the RTP heap manager to be used for all RTP projects built against the VSB project. Disabling this option will result in allowing the selection of using the legacy heap manager vs. the mimalloc heap manager on a per-RTP basis.

MIMALLOC_KERNEL_SECURE.summary: Enable mimalloc secure mode for kernel
MIMALLOC_KERNEL_SECURE.description: This option enables kernel MIMALLOC secure mode feature. There are four levels of support and each level is cumulative of the previous one.

MIMALLOC_KERNEL_SECURE_LEVEL1.description: This option adds guard page around each heap metadata.

MIMALLOC_KERNEL_SECURE_LEVEL2.description: This option adds guard page around each heap page.

MIMALLOC_KERNEL_SECURE_LEVEL3.description: This option enables free list encoding which detects corrupted free list and invalid pointer free.

MIMALLOC_KERNEL_SECURE_LEVEL4.description: This option enables checking of double free.

MIMALLOC_RTP_SECURE.summary: Enable mimalloc secure mode for RTPs
MIMALLOC_RTP_SECURE.description: This option enables RTP MIMALLOC secure mode feature. There are four levels of support and each level is cumulative of the previous one.

MIMALLOC_RTP_SECURE_LEVEL1.description: This option adds guard page around each heap metadata.

MIMALLOC_RTP_SECURE_LEVEL2.description: This option adds guard page around each heap page.

MIMALLOC_RTP_SECURE_LEVEL3.description: This option enables free list encoding which detects corrupted free list and invalid pointer free.

MIMALLOC_RTP_SECURE_LEVEL4.description: This option enables checking of double free.

MOSQUITTO_1_6_8_3.description: This layer provides the Mosquitto MQTT broker and library for VxWorks.

NTP_4_2_8p15_6.description: This provides network time protocol (NTP) support.

ONETBB_20_18_1_18.description: This provides the Intel oneAPI Threading Building Blocks (oneTBB) libraries.
